page.title: 10GOOLE RAIL LINK WITH HULL
page.content: The{railway}line to Hull was under threat of{closure}because a bridge over the River Ouse, built in 1868, was in need of immediate repair with an estimated cost of Â£2.2 million. Much of the{damage}was being caused by shipping on the river. Local people were very angry at this and the Goole and District Rail Action Group was formed to fight the closure. After many months of{negotiations}it was announced in January 1985 that a deal had been agreed with British Rail and Humberside County Council. The Council would pay Â£800,000 towards the repair and it meant that the bridge would{stay open}for at least another 10 years. In the same week that this was announced, the bridge was once again struck by a ship.
